Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black with reserved tondo; exterior: lip glazed; handle zone with black-figure frieze: preserved, sejant panther to right facing standing deer (of panther, part of rump and tail missing; of deer, rump and hind legs missing; both with added red on neck and body); lower body glazed with one reserved band. Part of ancient repair hole at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 43, pl. XXI, no. 50)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 410, no. B625)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1376) (phase 3)
